description: MS-2 — RAG Pipeline: Ingest, Embed, Retrieve. Deliver production-capable RAG retrieval foundation for text and assets with persistent Qdrant indexes, BM25 hybrid retrieval, and CLI tooling.

userStories.title: Verify deps + add QDRANT_PATH config
userStories.description: As a devops operator, I want Qdrant and embedding dependencies installed and configurable so that indexing can run in different runtime environments.
acceptanceCriteria: requirements.txt already contains: llama-index-retrievers-bm25, qdrant-client, llama-index-vector-stores-qdrant (verify these are present)
.env.example documents optional QDRANT_PATH with default value data/qdrant_db
Typecheck passes
userStories.notes: Bug fix: rank-bm25 is incorrect — the correct LlamaIndex BM25 integration is llama-index-retrievers-bm25

userStories.title: Create RAGIndexer with text Qdrant collection
userStories.description: As a platform engineer, I want documents indexed into Qdrant so that text retrieval is fast and repeatable.
acceptanceCriteria: src/rag/embeddings/indexer.py exists with RAGIndexer class
RAGIndexer loads documents via load_all_text_documents() from src/rag/data_processing/ingest.py
RAGIndexer creates text_documents collection under QDRANT_PATH with vectors from OpenAIEmbedding(model='text-embedding-3-small')
Documents passed directly to VectorStoreIndex without additional splitting (ingest.py handles pre-chunking)
Running indexing twice on same corpus replaces vectors deterministically without duplicates
Typecheck passes
userStories.notes: Bug fix: SentenceSplitter conflicts with ingest.py pre-chunking (20 rows/doc for CSVs). Pass docs directly to VectorStoreIndex.

userStories.title: Add BM25 build/load to RAGIndexer
userStories.description: As a retrieval engineer, I want BM25 indexes built and persisted so that hybrid lexical + dense retrieval works.
acceptanceCriteria: RAGIndexer builds BM25 index from same document corpus
BM25 artifacts persisted under data/index/bm25/ directory
data/index/bm25/ is non-empty after indexing
RAGIndexer can load persisted BM25 without rebuilding on second call
Typecheck passes

userStories.title: Add campaign_assets collection to RAGIndexer
userStories.description: As a campaign analyst, I want asset descriptions indexed in Qdrant so that asset search is available alongside text search.
acceptanceCriteria: RAGIndexer loads campaign assets from asset manifest metadata
RAGIndexer creates campaign_assets collection under QDRANT_PATH with same embedding model
campaign_assets collection contains >0 vectors after indexing
Asset metadata includes image_path field for later retrieval
Typecheck passes

userStories.title: Create query_engine.py with search_text()
userStories.description: As a query consumer, I want hybrid text search combining dense and lexical signals so relevance is strong for both semantic and keyword-heavy questions.
acceptanceCriteria: src/rag/retrieval/query_engine.py exists with search_text(query, top_k=5, category=None) function
search_text() uses QueryFusionRetriever over Qdrant and BM25 indexes
search_text() applies reciprocal reranking and returns ranked list of nodes
Each returned node has score, text, and metadata fields
Query 'What is Meta CPM?' returns nodes from meta_ads.csv or config metadata
Typecheck passes

userStories.title: Add search_assets() + check_indexes()
userStories.description: As a campaign analyst and operator, I want asset search and index health checks available so I can locate creatives and verify index status.
acceptanceCriteria: search_assets(query, top_k=5, channel=None) function exists in query_engine.py
search_assets() targets campaign_assets collection and supports optional channel filter
search_assets() returns nodes with image_path metadata without crashing on unknown channels
Query 'DEEPAL S07 launch creative' returns matching creative entries with valid image_path
check_indexes() function prints collection stats (name, vector_count, status) without mutating indexes
Typecheck passes

userStories.title: Create build_index.py CLI
userStories.description: As an operator, I want a CLI tool that can build indexes and verify health so I can manage indexing in production.
acceptanceCriteria: src/rag/data_processing/build_index.py exists and is runnable as: python -m src.rag.data_processing.build_index
CLI supports --text flag to build text_documents + BM25 indexes only
CLI supports --assets flag to build campaign_assets collection only
CLI supports --check flag to print index health without mutation
Running without flags defaults to full indexing (both text and assets) or explicitly documents default in help
Module uses QDRANT_PATH and other env config from .env
Typecheck passes
Tests pass

userStories.title: End-to-end dry-run: embed sample data and validate retrieval
userStories.description: As a developer, I want to run the full pipeline on sample files and verify results with smoke queries so I have confidence the code works against real data before the full production build.
acceptanceCriteria: python -m src.rag.data_processing.build_index --sample --dry-run prints estimate without errors
Estimated cost for sample files is under $1.00
python -m src.rag.data_processing.build_index --sample --text --max-cost-usd 5 completes successfully
text_documents Qdrant collection exists with >0 vectors after build
data/index/bm25/ directory exists and is non-empty after build
python -m src.rag.data_processing.build_index --sample --assets --max-cost-usd 5 completes successfully
campaign_assets Qdrant collection exists with >0 vectors after build
python -m src.rag.data_processing.build_index --check prints stats for both collections and BM25 index
Smoke query 'What is Meta CPM?' via search_text() returns nodes citing meta_ads.csv or config.py in top-5
Smoke query 'DEEPAL S07 launch creative' via search_assets() returns nodes with valid image_path metadata
Re-running the build on same data does not create duplicate vectors (collection vector count stays the same)
Typecheck passes
Tests pass
userStories.notes: This story requires OPENAI_API_KEY to be set. It calls the real OpenAI embedding API. Use --sample to limit to 6 predefined files (meta_ads.csv, tv_performance.csv, vehicle_sales.csv, MediaAgency_Terms_of_Business.md, config.py, asset_manifest.csv). Cost budget: --max-cost-usd 5 as safety guard.

userStories.title: Full production embedding: all data files
userStories.description: As a platform engineer, I want all data files (20 CSVs, 7 contracts, config, asset manifest) embedded into Qdrant and BM25 so the full corpus is searchable in production.
acceptanceCriteria: python -m src.rag.data_processing.build_index --dry-run prints estimate for full corpus without errors
Estimated cost for full corpus is under $5.00
python -m src.rag.data_processing.build_index --text --max-cost-usd 10 completes successfully
text_documents Qdrant collection exists with vectors from all 20 CSVs + 7 contracts + config.py
data/index/bm25/ directory is non-empty with full corpus BM25 artifacts
python -m src.rag.data_processing.build_index --assets --max-cost-usd 10 completes successfully
campaign_assets Qdrant collection contains vectors for all 50 asset manifest rows
python -m src.rag.data_processing.build_index --check prints stats showing full vector counts for both collections
Smoke query 'What is Meta CPM?' via search_text() returns relevant nodes in top-5
Smoke query 'TV performance reach' via search_text() returns nodes from tv_performance.csv
Smoke query 'DEEPAL S07 launch creative' via search_assets() returns nodes with valid image_path metadata
Re-running the build on same data does not create duplicate vectors
Typecheck passes
Tests pass
userStories.notes: Requires OPENAI_API_KEY. Runs WITHOUT --sample flag to embed the full corpus: 20 CSVs in data/raw/, 7 contracts in data/raw/contracts/, data/generators/config.py, and data/assets/asset_manifest.csv. Cost budget: --max-cost-usd 10 as safety guard. This replaces the sample indexes from US-008 with the full production indexes.
